m_szDocSumamry: Moth Eyeballs Inspire Glare-Dimming Gold-Coating For Solar Panels April 8th, 2014 by James Ayre   The glare from commonly used objects such as solar panels or electronics displays can be greatly reduced with the use of a newly developed transparent film black inspired by moth eyeballs. The new film — created by researchers at UC Irvine — can also aid in the main tangency of a clean surface, as it can also keep grime in raindrops and other moisture from sticking.
